languageKey.label: Web>Info modulet

Ideen med Web>Info modulet er at være et modul for andre moduler, der indeholder informationer og analyser af sider eller grene i sidetræet. Det kunne være website statistikker, caching status information osv.

Konceptuelt adskiller Web>Info modulet sig fra Web>Funktioner modulet hovedsageligt ved at vise information fremfor at tilbyde funktioner. Det er op til extension programmører at beslutte, hvilken af de to moduler, de ønsker at indsætte deres extensions i.

Web>Info modulet der leveres af kernen er en tom skal. Det giver en API som extensions kan bruge til at vedhæfte funktionsmenuelementer i Info modulet. Her kan du se "Page TSconfig" oversigten fra extensionen "info_pagetsconfig"
Web > Info module

The idea of the Web>Info module is to be a host module for backend applications that wish to present information / analysis of pages or branches of the page tree. This could be website statistics, caching status information etc.

Conceptually the Web>Info module is different from the Web>Functions module only by primarily showing information rather than offering functionality. It is up to extension programmers to decide in which of these two modules they want to insert functionality.

The Web>Info module as provided by the core is an empty shell. It provides an API that extensions can use to attach function menu items to the Info module. Here you see the "Page TSconfig" overview from the extension "info_pagetsconfig".
